Authors: Aqsha, Fauziyah U., Tee K., Kaburuan E.R.
Title: Planning catering business model for E-commerce SOA based: AU-OR!
Source title: International Journal of Recent Technology and Engineering
Authors with affiliations: Aqsha, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Fauziyah, U., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Tee, K., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Kaburuan, E.R., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: The population and the many activities of people in big cities like Jakarta make catering become one of the services that are needed by the community. Society is one reason that catering services are needed. The need to order catering has increased to become an opportunity in the food service business. But in practice, it is difficult to find information about the catering that is needed information or marketing from the seller of the service that is felt lacking. The purpose of this study is to design e-commerce applications for catering businesses based on service-oriented architecture (SOA) so that they can integrate several service selling entities and help people find easier food service. The benefit of this research is finding an e-commerce application design for the catering business, can get catering information more easily and can make catering reservations easier. The method used in this research is observation on the respondent who are a catering consumer and business canvas model from the observation. The results of this study are SWOT Analysis, Business Model Canvas, and the design of e-commerce prototypes for catering businesses that can be used in catering industry which will going to e-commerce industry. © BEIESP.

Authors: Fauziyah U., Kaburuan E.R., Wang G., Aqsha
Title: Gamification for Employee Training Platform in Banking Industries
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fauziyah, U., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kaburuan, E.R., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wang, G., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aqsha, Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As one of the most recognized banks in Indonesia, Bank Mandiri has a mission to develop a perfect learning system that enables all of its staffs to face competition challenges and adapt to a sophisticated environment. The article takes the case study of gamification design in the IT department, where the staffs are expected to deliver advanced IT solutions. The article examines the gamification design with objectives to provide a reference for corporate training in the banking industry. The study uses qualitative methods in observation, and analysis the content of gamification implemented to the online learning platform. The outcome of the article is expected to introduce an attractive learning platform that can be accessed by all staffs in any time and any place with the presence of a virtual tutor, as an alternative to traditional learning. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: E-learning; Information management; Learning systems; Banking industry; Corporate trainings; Employee training; Gamification; Learning platform; Online learning; Qualitative method; Traditional learning; Personnel training
